verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of Nineveh.<WH5210> The book<WH5612> of the vision<WH2377> of Nahum<WH5151> the Elkoshite.<WH512>

God <WH410> is jealous,<WH7072> and the LORD<WH3068> revengeth;<WH5358> the LORD<WH3068> revengeth,<WH5358> and is furious;<WH1167> <WH2534> the LORD<WH3068> will take vengeance<WH5358> on his adversaries,<WH6862> and he<WH1931> reserveth<WH5201> wrath for his enemies.<WH341>

The LORD<WH3068> is slow<WH750> to anger,<WH639> and great<WH1419> in power,<WH3581> and will not at all acquit<WH5352> <WH3808> <WH5352> the wicked: the LORD<WH3068> hath his way<WH1870> in the whirlwind<WH5492> and in the storm,<WH8183> and the clouds<WH6051> are the dust<WH80> of his feet.<WH7272>

He rebuketh<WH1605> the sea,<WH3220> and maketh it dry,<WH3001> and drieth up<WH2717> all<WH3605> the rivers:<WH5104> Bashan<WH1316> languisheth,<WH535> and Carmel,<WH3760> and the flower<WH6525> of Lebanon<WH3844> languisheth.<WH535>

The mountains<WH2022> quake<WH7493> at<WH4480> him, and the hills<WH1389> melt,<WH4127> and the earth<WH776> is burned<WH5375> at his presence,<WH4480> <WH6440> yea, the world,<WH8398> and all<WH3605> that dwell<WH3427> therein.

Who <WH4310> can stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> his indignation?<WH2195> and who<WH4310> can abide<WH6965> in the fierceness<WH2740> of his anger?<WH639> his fury<WH2534> is poured out<WH5413> like fire,<WH784> and the rocks<WH6697> are thrown down<WH5422> by<WH4480> him.
The LORD<WH3068> is good,<WH2896> a stronghold<WH4581> in the day<WH3117> of trouble;<WH6869> and he knoweth<WH3045> them that trust<WH2620> in him.
But with an overrunning<WH5674> flood<WH7858> he will make<WH6213> an utter end<WH3617> of the place<WH4725> thereof, and darkness<WH2822> shall pursue<WH7291> his enemies.<WH341>
What <WH4100> do ye imagine<WH2803> against<WH413> the LORD?<WH3068> he<WH1931> will make<WH6213> an utter end:<WH3617> affliction<WH6869> shall not<WH3808> rise up<WH6965> the second time.<WH6471>

For <WH3588> while<WH5704> they be folded together<WH5440> as thorns,<WH5518> and while they are drunken<WH5435> as drunkards,<WH5433> they shall be devoured<WH398> as stubble<WH7179> fully<WH4390> dry.<WH3002>
There is one come out<WH3318> of<WH4480> thee, that imagineth<WH2803> evil<WH7451> against<WH5921> the LORD,<WH3068> a wicked<WH1100> counselor.<WH3289>

Thus <WH3541> saith<WH559> the LORD;<WH3068> Though<WH518> they be quiet,<WH8003> and likewise<WH3651> many,<WH7227> yet thus<WH3651> shall they be cut down,<WH1494> when he shall pass through.<WH5674> Though I have afflicted<WH6031> thee, I will afflict<WH6031> thee no<WH3808> more.<WH5750>
For now<WH6258> will I break<WH7665> his yoke<WH4132> from off<WH4480> <WH5921> thee, and will burst thy bonds in sunder.<WH5423> <WH4147>

And the LORD<WH3068> hath given a commandment<WH6680> concerning<WH5921> thee, that no<WH3808> more<WH5750> of thy name<WH4480> <WH8034> be sown:<WH2232> out of the house<WH4480> <WH1004> of thy gods<WH430> will I cut off<WH3772> the graven image<WH6459> and the molten image:<WH4541> I will make<WH7760> thy grave;<WH6913> for<WH3588> thou art vile.<WH7043>

Behold <WH2009> upon<WH5921> the mountains<WH2022> the feet<WH7272> of him that bringeth good tidings,<WH1319> that publisheth<WH8085> peace!<WH7965> O Judah,<WH3063> keep<WH2287> thy solemn feasts,<WH2282> perform<WH7999> thy vows:<WH5088> for<WH3588> the wicked<WH1100> shall no<WH3808> more<WH3254> <WH5750> pass through<WH5674> thee; he is utterly<WH3605> cut off.<WH3772>
